cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across south Florida tonight, then into the southeast Gulf and turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef (southeast FL Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and south Florida tonight and Saturday; northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle late Sunday through Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with a 23% chance of sustained 34-kt winds; most likely 20–35 mph gusts Saturday–early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the west-central Florida coast in the current forecast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated 5 inches; risk of flash flooding and minor river flooding in the Tampa Bay area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated flash flooding, minor river rises, and the chance of waterspouts in adjacent coastal waters
